description: [Status: stable] [Name: typing-text-str-alias] [Message: {}.Text is deprecated, use str] What it does Checks for uses of typing.Text. In preview mode, also checks for typing_extensions.Text. Why is this bad? typing.Text is an alias for str, and only exists for Python 2 compatibility. As of Python 3.11, typing.Text is deprecated. Use str instead. Example from typing import Text foo: Text = "bar" Use instead: foo: str = "bar"
